text: Charlie Allen (born 22 November 2003) is a Northern Irish footballer who plays as a midfielder or forward for Leeds United and Northern Ireland U17's. ==Club career== ===Linfield=== Having progressed through the academy of local club Linfield, Allen made his senior debut for the club on 27 April 2019 in a 1–1 draw with Coleraine. Upon making his debut, aged 15 years, 5 months and 5 days, he became the club's youngest debutant and set teammate Daniel Reynolds up for Linfield's goal. He was named in Linfield's 25 man Champions League squad against Rosenborg BK by manager David Healy. ===Leeds United=== On 27 July 2020, the Yorkshire Evening Post revealed that Allen had agreed a deal with newly promoted Premier League side Leeds United. The move was officially announced on 11 August, with Allen signing a three-year deal.
